The equity shares of Bharat Coking Coal Ltd (BCCL) are set to debut on Indian stock exchanges today, Monday, January 19, 2026.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: What Lemonn Markets Desk says about listing

The BCCL IPO goes beyond a standard market listing; it represents a strategic move to unlock hidden value. For Coal India shareholders, it could signal the beginning of a sustained, long-term cycle of value creation, with the potential to generate over Rs 1 lakh crore in additional shareholder wealth by FY2030.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: BCCL pre-open price soars ahead of listing

Ahead of its stock market debut, Bharat Coking Coal’s pre-open price jumps 96.57% to Rs 45.21.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Anchor investors in BCCL IPO

Several prominent global and domestic institutional investors participated in the anchor round, including Life Insurance Corporation, Societe Generale, Copthall Mauritius Investment Ltd, Citrine Fund, M7 Global Fund PCC - ASAS Global Opportunities Fund, Maybank Securities, and Rajasthan Global Securities.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Lead manager and registrar details

IDBI Capital Markets Services Ltd acted as the book running lead manager for the issue, while Kfin Technologies Ltd served as the registrar.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Subscription across investor categories

The IPO received overwhelming demand, with overall subscription reaching 146.87 times, as per NSE data. The retail individual investors' portion was subscribed 49.33 times, while the qualified institutional buyers' segment saw a subscription of 310.81 times. The non-institutional investors' category was subscribed 258.16 times.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Issue size and price band

Bharat Coking Coal IPO was priced in the range of Rs 21 to Rs 23 per share. The company raised Rs 1,071.11 crore through the book-built issue, which was entirely an offer for sale of 46.57 crore equity shares.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: IPO timeline and listing date

The public issue opened for subscription on Friday, January 9, and closed on Tuesday, January 13, with the basis of allotment finalised on January 14. Bharat Coking Coal shares are scheduled to list on Monday, January 19, on both the BSE and NSE.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Strong listing outlook with caution on sector cycles

Overall, she said the combination of heavy subscription and upbeat grey market indicators reflects a positive market outlook for BCCL at the time of listing. However, she advised investors to stay cautious about the cyclical nature of the sector once the initial listing momentum fades.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Pre-listing indicators signal strong debut

Shivani Nyati, Head of Wealth at Swastika Investmart Ltd, said pre-listing cues for Bharat Coking Coal shares suggest a strong market debut. She highlighted that the company holds strategic importance in India's coking coal segment, supplying a key raw material to the domestic steel industry and benefiting from long-term structural demand. Nyati added that grey market trends have further strengthened positive sentiment around the stock. According to her, the sharp rise in GMP points to expectations of listing gains of about 62 per cent over the issue price, reflecting strong demand at debut. However, she cautioned that performance after listing will be influenced by factors such as coal price movements, operational efficiency, and policy changes in the mining and energy sectors.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Valuation seen as attractive with positive long-term outlook

From a valuation standpoint, Tapse said the IPO was priced reasonably, particularly for a low-ticket issue, and offers a favourable risk-reward proposition. He added that with a strong market position and structural demand support from continued expansion in steelmaking capacity, the medium- to long-term outlook for the company remains positive.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Analysts see strong premium on listing

Market experts expect Bharat Coking Coal's IPO to list at a healthy premium to its issue price. Prashanth Tapse, Senior Vice President (Research) at Mehta Equities Ltd, said the stock is likely to debut in the range of Rs 32 to Rs 35 per share, indicating a premium of about 39 to 52 per cent over the issue price.

He noted that the IPO saw exceptionally strong demand across qualified institutional buyers (QIBs), non-institutional investors (NIIs) and retail categories, highlighting solid investor confidence. According to him, interest in the issue was largely driven by its scarcity value, as the IPO offered a rare chance to gain exposure to India's largest and most integrated player in the coking coal value chain, which is a key input for the domestic steel industry.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Grey market signals strong listing premium

Ahead of the listing, grey market trends suggest a robust debut. Bharat Coking Coal IPO GMP today is around Rs 13.6 per share, indicating an estimated listing price of about Rs 36.6 per share-over 59 per cent higher than the IPO issue price of Rs 23.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: Special pre-open session before trading

The exchange also said the stock will be part of the Special Pre-open Session (SPOS) on January 19, after which normal trading in the shares will begin from 10:00 am.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: BSE listing and trading details

According to a BSE notice, the equity shares of Bharat Coking Coal Limited will be listed and admitted for trading in the 'B' Group of Securities with effect from Monday, January 19, 2026.

Bharat Coking Coal Share Price Live: IPO timeline and investor response

The Coal India Ltd subsidiary's IPO attracted strong demand from investors. The mainboard issue opened on January 9 and closed on January 13, with the basis of allotment finalised on January 14. The shares are set to be listed today on both the BSE and NSE.
